Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. \nA musical evening of Soul's Diet in ci.description: Chandigarh Sangeet Natak Akademi presented a soulful musical evening by Soul's Diet, a Chandigarh based community music group at Tagore Theatre on Wednesday. Soul's Diet is a Chandigarh based band formed by Vikram and Gurleen. Through this band they are trying to create and present a different flavour of music. They sing poetry written by Sufi mystics and contemporary poets. Their main intention is to bring a moment of stillness and silence in people through their music. The musical evening commenced by singing of self-composed Sufi songs from mystics like Meera Shah, Khwaja Ghulam Fareed, Baba Farid and poems of contemporary poets like Sukhwinder Amrit and Kamaljeet Kaur. UT fails to protect its heritage.description: CHANDIGARH: The Chandigarh administration has miserably failed to stop auction of city’s heritage furniture items by foreign auction houses. In the last three years, foreign auction houses have earned Rs 6.20 crore by selling heritage furniture items designed by Chandigarh’s creator French architect Le Corbusier, his cousin Pierre Jeanneret and others associated with the founding and planning of the city. In a recent auction of artefacts belonging to the city, furniture items designed by Le Corbusier and Pierre Jeanneret were auctioned for Rs 1.12 crore in New York. Though the UT administration had started working on to stop the auction and had even written to these auction houses, but to no avail. A UT official said they had sought assistance of the French government in preserving city’s heritage buildings and furniture. A letter in this regard was written by UT adviser Manoj Parida to French ambassador Alexandre Ziegler, wherein the UT had asked for help from cultural experts of the French government, he added. The UT administration had even prepared an inventory of as many as 12,793 heritage items belonging to Chandigarh. Notably, the entities include furniture, tapestry, drawings and other things, which were designed, made and used by Le Corbusier, Pierre Jeanneret and others associated with the founding and planning of Chandigarh in the 1950s and 60s, comes under the category of heritage items. Chandigarh reportedly has 12,793 heritage items designed by Corbusier or his team. As per the report, there are 190 categories of the heritage items, including drawings, murals, models, tapestries, chairs and tables. In Chandigarh, UT Government Museum and Art Gallery has possession of a large number of heritage items, including furniture, drawings, murals, models among others, made by Corbusier and his other associates. Besides, Punjab and Haryana civil secretariat, Punjab and Haryana vidhan sabha, Punjab and Haryana high court also have huge stock of heritage furniture, including chairs and tables. Le Corbusier and Pierre Jeanneret had designed these heritage furniture items. Both used to design chairs, tables, stools, and racks for government offices in the late 1950s. The designed furniture lot was replaced in the late 1980s and early 1990s, after which the administration had tossed the items in its backyards and stores. Unaware of the furniture’s international worth, most UT departments had auctioned the old furniture thinking it as junk. To preserve its heritage artefacts, the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) had recently asked the UT administration for taking corrective steps. The ASI director general had advised the UT administration to prepare an inventory of heritage items with subsequent authentication of their authorship. It had also suggested that a museum dedicated to Le Corbusier and his team can be established, which will prevent taking these works of art out of India. Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Here's a look at different yoga styles and its growing popularity worldwide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Job fair by UT Police to keep youth on r.description: By: Tanya Vij CHANDIGARH: A job fair was organized by the Chandigarh Police on Thursday for the students, who had been given police training. As many as 480 students were trained under vocational courses for three months under the Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojna Scheme. Counselling sessions were also conducted for students. "This training programme will benefit juvenile offenders, victims of crime and underprivileged youth. Under the scheme, all training expenses are being taken by the Chandigarh Police. As many as 150 students have already been enrolled for their respective jobs," said director general, Chandigarh Police, Sanjay Baniwal Training was given to students under four major sections: Food and beverages, retail store assistant, beauty therapist and retail sales associate. "We are making a lot of effort to help these children. The police force have a duty to not only protect the public from crime, but also to teach the underprivileged, to change their mindset, invest their time in productive activities such as this scheme that has given hundreds the chance to be able to enrol in skilled jobs," Baniwal added. "I am grateful to the Chandigarh Police for training me free of cost and helping me to become capable enough to apply for a job. This opportunity will be a great support in running my household and looking after my children," said Promila, a single mother of two. . "The training partners and government has helped in training these people. This will give a boost to the youth and increase their confidence manifold. During the course of training constructive technique was taught that will help bring youth involved in illegal and wrong activities on the right track," said UT SSP Nilambari Jagadale, who was the officer-in-charge of the project. \nCancer survivors raise the spirits\n.description: As many as 100 cancer survivors along with their doctors celebrated National Cancer Survivors’ Day at IMA Bhawan. The doctors including Dr Sachin Gupta, Dr Sunanadan Sharma, Dr Gautam Goel ,Dr Ritesh Pruthi, Dr Pankaj Kumar and Dr Sajal Kakkar from a Mohali hospital joined survivors in bhangra. Sandeep Dogra said that all have gathered today to show the world that life after a cancer treatment is equally rewarding, fulfilling and inspiring. A jubilant survivor, Surbhi (37) from Pinjore said, “My treatment went on for about 9-month, which was pretty long, but it made me stronger as a person and now I feel fearless and ready to take on any challenge that life will throw at me. The journey completely transformed my outlook towards life & personality and has increased my self-belief.” Another survivor, Amritpal Kaur from Jalandhar said, “Many aspects of life have changed for me like others who sailed in the same boat. No more crying over little issues and most importantly, I have started to sincerely value my life, by taking care of my diet, fitness and most importantly, doing what makes me feel happy.” “My will power to fight cancer came solely from the love and support, i got from my family during the treatment. As a survivor, i request each and every family member to be very positive, calm and hopeful whenever around the patient.”, maintained Lakhwinder from Chandigarh Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Illegal colonies to face action: Sukhbin.description: MOHALI: Illegal colonizers could be in for some stren action if the Punjab cabinet minister, Sukhbinder Singh Sarkaria is to be believed. After assuming office, the minister said that the colonizers will be at the receiving end, on the contrary, those violating the building byelaws conitue to benefit the lax attitude of the Greater Mohali Area Development Authority (GMADA). Despite the fact that GMADA claimed to have issued notices to such violators, it has so far failed to take any action to get the government land freed or force the violators to abide by the bylaws. The government departments responsible for defending the government land from being encroached by the residents have been sitting idle and have not taken any concrete action till date. In June last year, MC had conducted a survey and identified around 4000 residents who have violated the norms and have encroached upon the government land. No action has been taken after that and residents have taken the things for granted. Violations like demolishing the boundary walls and including the government land in the plot area either in front of the house of at the back side, constructing extra room on the third floor apart from ‘mumty’ are larger violations found in Mohali. Recently another such violation came to light in phase 3-A, following which the area councillor cum deputy mayor Manjit Singh Sethi has lodged a formal complaint with GMADA. Following the complaints, GMADA had issued notices to the residents but the no action has been taken after that, claimed Sethi. The complaint has been made against house number 41, 42 and 43 in phase 3-A where the residents have included government land as part of their construction by demolishing the back-side boundary wall. Similarly, extra room has been constructed on the second floor of house number 237, sector 70 Mohali which has been recently constructed apart from ‘mumpty’.  Residents believe that GMADA has been just issuing notices for the sake of becoming answerable but not taking any action. Denying llegations, GMADA estate officer (housing) Mahesh Bansal said, “There is no such provision in rules to grant permission to include government land in a residential plot and to demolish the boundary wall. It is gross violation of the building bylaws and we will get them checked. Notices have been issued to such violators and in due course of law is being followed.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

After Punjab and Haryana high court wrat.description: CHANDIGARH: In the wake of Punjab and Haryana high court’s rap for some apparent lapses in investigation in cases related to prohibition of cow slaughter, Haryana DGP has ordered special training for police officers posted in Nuh district of Mewat area. Nuh accounts for the maximum number of cases registered under the Haryana Gauvansh Sanrakshan and Gausamvardhan Act, 2015. Haryana DGP Manoj Yadava has sent a letter to the director, Haryana Police Academy (HPA), Madhuban in Karnal, to launch a special training for investigating officers (IOs) of Nuh district. “Copy of all 13 judgments along with reasons of failure are being sent to you with the request to independently examine these and find out deficiencies in the investigation. After study of judgment and the cow protection Act, a special training programme should be launched for investigating officers of Nuh district,” says the DGP’s communication. The SP Nuh has also been told to ensure that all IOs of the district are sent to HPA Madhuban for training in batches. Justice Mahabir Singh Sindhu of the HC had observed in its April 5 orders, “The extreme failure on the part of the prosecution/police can be inferred from the fact that till date, 13 criminal cases have been decided by the courts of competent jurisdiction in Nuh district for commission of offences under the Act of 2015 and all the cases, resulted into the acquittal and not even a single person has been convicted....” Justice Sindhu had then asked the state authorities to find a solution of this. Thereafter, the state police have taken several steps in view of HC’s observations. Observing that the accused are indulging in the offence because of the major economic incentives attached with this illegal activity, the police have also decided to plead before the trial court not to release the vehicles used in the crime on Superdari as it will result in economic loss to the accused and prove an effective deterrent. The Haryana government has also informed the HC that state is contemplating a mechanism to ensure proper guidance for export/transportation of the cows from or within Haryana state. Looking at the seriousness and sensitivity of the matter, Justice Mahabir Singh Sindhu has also decided to monitor the issue and had recently appointed advocate Deepak Balyan as amicus curiae in the matter. Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Businessman gets relief from UT court, R.description: CHANDIGARH: A UT district court has set aside an order of district magistrate-cum-adjudicating officer in which a city-based shopkeeper was fined Rs 2.50 lakh for misbranding. The court has reduced the fine amount to Rs 75,000. An appeal was filed by a Khajeri resident, Naresh Kumar Mittal, against the order passed by district magistrate Ajit Balaji Joshi. The prosecution stated that on January 16, 2015, food safety officer Surinder Pal Singh inspected M/s Mittal Namkeen Products and took random sample of some items. In the analysis report it was stated that the sweet mentioned on the label of the samples were not found inside. The report was then sent to the food business operator through a registered post. It was mentioned that he had the liberty to file an appeal against the said analysis report. However, no such appeal was preferred by him before the designated officer. Thereafter, the adjudicating officer imposed a penalty of Rs 2.5 lakh upon him. The appellant then contested that the entire procedure adopted by the said authority was vitiated and the same was liable to be set aside by allowing the appeal. The further argument then was the amount of penalty was disproportionate and therefore was liable to be reduced. Allowing the appeal, the court held that penalty of Rs 75,000 would make the ends of justice meet. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

One held with 1 kg charas.description: CHANDIGARH: Operation cell of the UT police has arrested a drug peddler and seized 1 kg charas from his possession from near PGI on Wednesday. According to the cops, the accused has been identified as Karam Chand, a resident of Mani Majra. The operation cell team members had laid a naka on the dividing road of PGI and Khuda Lahora. During checking, they noticed the accused coming towards the check post in his car. The cops stopped him and during checking of his car, they reportedly recovered 1 kg charas. The accused has been arrested and a case has been registered under the NDPS Act. During investigation, the accused revealed that he had procured the drugs from Kullu in Himachal Pradesh. He will be produced before a local court for further remand on Thursday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Mat in place, Tricity is all set for Yog.description: CHANDIGARH: If you are an avid tweeter and Prime Minister (PM) Narendra Modi follower, chances are that you have mastered at least 10 asanas by now, thanks to those animated Yoga sessions of PM Modi that has been announcing the 5th International Yoga Day in style. Come Yoga Day, you can show off your flexibility and equipoise at one of the many events being organized in Tricity to commemorate that day. So, roll up your Yoga mats and pick an event to breathe in, breathe out with millions on June 21. The main event will be celebrated in Sector 17 plaza, between 5am to 8am. This is where the real action is: The place you should be if you want to rub shoulders with who's who of Chandigarh. For instance, both MP Kirron Kher and Governor of Punjab V P Singh Badnore are scheduled to appear at Sector 17 gala. Unfortunately, registration for the plaza has been closed and more than 3,000 have registered . If you have missed the registration, don't worry, Yoga Day will be celebrated in 80-odd parks all over Chandigarh, 48 government schools, 10 health and wellness centres, almost every NGOs, Police Hospital in Sector 26, dispensaries and most of the government offices. The registrations in government schools are still open and word is that the Ayush department has hired 48 excellent Yoga instructors to teach at government schools.  Head to sports complex in Mohali The sports complex at Sector 78 in Mohali is the place to be between 7am and 8am. The preparations for the celebration are already started by the sports department. Incidentally, just so you get your pauses and poses right, there's even a "rehearsal day" on June 20. Cabinet minister of Punjab Balbir Singh Sidhu will be the guest of honour of the event which is expected to host nearly 5,000 people Surjeet Singh, officiating district sports officer, Mohali, said, "The Yoga Day will be celebrated according to the protocols issued by the AYUSH ministry." He also added that a rehearsal will be held on June 20 at the sports complex. According to him, trainers have been conducting workshops and seminars for two months at various departments of the state to prepare for the Yoga Day. Government officials, cops, teachers, different NGOs, students, workers, doctors... June 21 will see people from different walks of life will be walking that extra mile - or rather doing that extra stretch - to prove to the world the efficacy of India's legacy. If you are still hesitating because you can't tell between shalabhasanas and vakrasanas, there's time yet to rectify that. Patanjali Yoga committee, the mediator of International Yoga Day, is organizing two-day training camps in Mohali. Nirmal Kumar, district incharge of Bharat Swabhimaan said, "The two-day Yoga training camp will be conducted in Ram Bhawan, Kharad on June 19 and 20." While you are at it, you might want to check out the free-of-cost health check-up and consultation services.  Parade Ground it is in Panchkula The main celebration will be held at Parade Ground in Sector 5. The event organized by Panchkula. district administration and AYUSH department, will be conducted by Patanjali Yog Samiti. The star burnign bright in Panchkula will be the MP Rattan Lal Katariya. According to Dilip Kumar, district ayurvedic officer, Panchkula, people who haven't done Yoga at all are also welcome for the event as the instructors from Patanjali Yog Samiti will be guiding everyone. Like the rest of the world, in Panchkula, too, people from all walks of life are expected to participate in the events organized to celebrate Yoga Day. Since it believes practice makes an asana, Panchkula had organized training camps between June 13 and June 15 at Parade Ground from 6 am to 7.30 am. On June 19, a "pilot rehearsal" was held at the Parade Ground. A marathon from Yavnika Park in Sector 5 was also organized. According to Panchkula deputy commissioner (DC) Balkar Singh, who flagged off the marathon, Yoga should not be restricted to one day or one week, but should be a part of everyone's daily routine. Apart from the main event, there are also countless other local events being organized on June 21. For instance, Divya Yog Mandir in Shivalik Enclave, NAC, Manimajra will celebrate between 7am and 8am. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Minorities panel seeks report from Punja.description: CHANDIGARH: Acting on a complaint lodged by a Punjab resident, the National Commission for Minorities has sought a report from the Punjab government for using the picture of Gautam Buddha in its Mahavir Jayanti advertisement. In a communication to Punjab chief secretary, the commission has sought a detailed report within seven days. The state government had in April issued an advertisement on the eve of Mahavir Jayanti, in which photograph of Gautam Buddha was carried. Sandeep Kumar Jain, the state coordinator for Vishwa Jain Sangathan, had lodged a complaint with the state government and the minorities panel. After the goof-up, the state government had issued a clarification stating that the picture used in the advertisement was imagination of an artist. But, terming it a lame excuse “to cover up the mistake”, Jain said that by using a wrong photograph, the state government had hurt the religious sentiments of the Jain community. The community is seeking an apology from the government for the mistake. “Use of wrong photo showcased the insensitivity of the government towards minorities,” Jain claimed. \nCancer survivors get treated to a film.description: Nearly 150 cancer survivors and their near & dear ones today bonded with their doctors and nurses over a film and popcorn as they enjoyed themselves at an exclusive screening of the Salman Khan starrer latest fim ‘Bharat’ organised for them by Saarthak, the cancer support group of a cancer institute in Mohali, at a city-based mall multiplex. The get-together of the cancer survivors was done on Cancer Survivor’s Day that is celebrated worldwide to demonstrate that life after a cancer diagnosis can be a reality. The cancer survivors thoroughly enjoyed the movie as well as the snacks served to them. “When you are faced with this dreaded disease, your life changes dramatically and you tend to become depressed and full of self-pity,” stated Satish Bhatia, who was diagnosed with cancer and underwent treatment at the institute. Dr Rajeev Bedi, director of the institute in Mohali suggested to the cancer survivors to reach out to other members of the community and get them to join any free support group like Saarthak. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AAP flays Cong govt over groundwater man.description: Chandiagrh: Raising the issue of depleting water table, the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has accused Capt Amarinder Singh-led Congress government in Punjab of failing to take corrective steps for groundwater management. Despite being an agrarian state, Punjab is yet to have a state water policy, said senior AAP leader Aman Arora, adding that the state is facing acute water scarcity due to a lax approach of the state government over the years. The Sunam MLA said a policy is the need of the hour to check the fast depleting groundwater table in the state, as the water obtained through natural resources is going a waste and the excessive use of groundwater would render the prime land in the state barren. The AAP leader added that in comparison to the available 17.54 million acre feet (MAF) groundwater, every year Punjab’s 14 lakh tubewells are pulling out 29.01 MAF, leading to 40 cm depletion of ground water level every year, which is a matter of grave concern. Arora said that it is indeed unfortunate that both SAD and Congress are trying to trivialize a serious issue like groundwater management by playing politics for the past close to four decades now, depriving the due share of water under the anti-Punjab water agreement (1981). Quoting the data available, Arora said that out of its total share of 245.62 MAF water in the last 37 years, the state has utilized 227.67 MAF, which is 8% less than the allotted quota which could have irrigated at least 1.25 lakh acres of land in the state. Neighboring Haryana, he claimed, has utilised 141.87 MAF water against its total share of 132.19 MAF during the period, which is 8% more than the allotted share. Arora alleged that the situation the state is facing is nothing but a fallout of the wrong agreement signed with the neighboring states. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Khair tree thieves strike twice in Pinjo.description: PANCHKULA: ‘Khair trees’ thieves once again struck at two places in Pinjore, axing 15 trees. In one of the cases, the thieves were caught by a forest guard, while signs of tree felling were found at the other site. Police received a complaint cops from Manjit Singh, sarpanch of Johluwal village, Pinjore, that unknown persons had stolen 10 khair trees from the panchayati land . A complaint was moved to the cops by panchayat secretary Dalbir Singh. Cops based on the complaint and after visiting the land registered a case under section 379 (punishment for theft) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) at the Pinjore police station. In the second case, a complaint was given to the police by gram panchayat of Nanakpur village of Pinjore. It alleged that on Tuesday night four unknown persons axed khair trees in a forest area. Forest officer Joginder Singh, forest guards Sachin and Suresh, chowkidars Sanjeev Kumar and Gurwinder Singh caught one out of four thieves red-handed, while the others managed to flee. The officers found five axed trees from the spot. From the accused identified as Mukesh, cops recovered a saw, a scooter and a mobile phone. A case under section 379 of the IPC was registered at the the Pinjore police station against Mukesh and his three accomplices. Pinjore police station inspector Mukesh Kumar said, “Khair is a reserved category tree and its demand is high in the market for its multiple use. We have registered a case based on the complaint. The investigation is under progress.” The tree is known for its medicinal properties like curing skin, neck and tooth problems. The red part of the wood is mainly used for making ‘katha’, a main ingredient for making pan. A quintal of the tree costs between Rs 5,000 to Rs 50,000 as per the demand. This is not the first instance of illegal felling of khair trees in the forest area of Panchkula as multiple similar cases have been reported with the police from forest department. India Pakistan news.description: NEW DELHI/ISLAMABAD: India dismissed on Thursday as "fake news" the suggestion in Pak media that it was looking to resume talks with the hostile neighbour and asserted that there was no dilution of its position that Islamabad needed to take verifiable and irreversible action against terrorism for the dialogue to resume. Responding to Pakistan PM Imran Khan's congratulatory letter after he assumed office for the second time, PM Narendra Modi wrote back on June 12 expressing India's desire to have normal and cooperative relations with all its neighbours, including Pakistan, while stressing that "for this, it is important to build an environment of trust, free of terror, violence and hostility". Foreign minister S Jaishankar also wrote to his Pakistani counterpart S M Qureshi, again only in response to the latter's congratulatory letter, emphasising the need for an atmosphere "free from the shadow of terror and violence". The emphasis on the need for Pakistan to rein in terror as a pre-condition for re-engagement was in keeping with the stand which saw Modi refrain from engaging with Imran Khan at the just-concluded SCO summit in Kyrgyzstan. Yet, the Pakistani media chose to interpret the contents of the letters of Modi and Jaishankar as reflecting India's desire to re-engage. The foreign ministry in Delhi quickly scotched the suggestion. "There was complete distortion and an attempt to peddle fake news (in the way it was reported). The letters only reiterated India's old position that it wants normal and cooperative relations with all countries in South Asia and that it was important to create an environment free of terror and violence for it. There was no mention of any sort of dialogue with Pakistan," said MEA spokesperson Raveesh Kumar, adding that India will not be fooled by any cosmetic action against terror by Islamabad. Emphasising that both the letters were written in as per the "established diplomatic practice", Kumar said: "In their messages, they have highlighted that India seeks normal and cooperative relations with all neighbours, including Pakistan." In his letter, Modi had said that India remained committed to operationalising early an "all-year-round" Kartarpur corridor. Touching upon it, Kumar said India had already held three technical-level discussions with Pakistan and was currently awaiting clarification from Islamabad over a few issues it had raised. Puzzlingly, later in the evening, Pakistan's foreign ministry, which had kept quiet through the day, also sought to play down the speculation about the import of the letters. While responding to a question, the spokesperson said, "It was an established practice for the leadership to congratulate new office holders and for them to respond." "Pakistan's position on the way forward in relations with India was clear and well-known and did not require repetition," said the spokesperson, adding that the "vision of peace, progress and prosperity of South Asia could be advanced by peacefully resolving all outstanding disputes, including Jammu & Kashmir, and moving away from dynamic of confrontation to cooperation". Earlier in the day, sources in the Pakistan foreign office had said that Modi and Jaishankar had responded positively to recent letters from their Pakistani counterparts by conveying New Delhi's desire to engage with all countries, including Pakistan, for elimination of terrorism and prosperity of the region. "India has always prioritised peace and human development, and sought to maintain cordial relations with all regional powers," Modi and Jaishankar maintained, according to FO sources. Both leaders, according to FO sources, called for special attention on elimination of terrorism in the region and said the issue must be a core focus in all future talks. They have also appreciated sentiments from Pakistan in their letters, the FO sources added. Modi's letter was in response to a congratulatory letter from Khan in which he had underscored Pakistan's vision of working for "durable peace and stability in South Asia with peaceful resolution of all outstanding disputes, including J&K". Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. \nSummer camp concludes\n.description: This summer, DPS, Chandigarh organised a summer camp for the children from May 16 to June 1, 2019 for tiny tots and May 22 to June 1, 2019 for senior group. The children participated in a number of fun activities like I- spy game, sprinkler fun, Bollywood day, theme parties, grooming sessions and art and craft. Theatre Robotics and Nutty Scientist were offered to students in the senior category. The camp concluded with a special celebration of Father's Day (junior category), and a theatre display (senior category). Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Punjab and Haryana HC allows DNA test of.description: CHANDIGARH: The Punjab and Haryana high court has allowed DNA test of two accused in the Morni gang-rape case, saying the profiling was part of a fair trial. “A fair trial is the heart of the criminal jurisprudence. It is well settled that denial of fair trial is crucifixion of human rights. While emphasizing the principle of fair trial and the practice of the same in the course of trial, it is obligatory on the part of the courts to see whether in an individual case or category of cases, because of non-compliance of a certain provision, reversion of judgment of conviction is inevitable or it is dependent on arriving at an indubitable conclusion that substantial injustice has in fact occurred,” observed the HC while allowing DNA of two accused. Justice Raj Shekhar Attri passed the orders while allowing the petition filed by a Sonipat resident and one more accused. Both the petitioners had approached the HC, challenging the order dated April 10 last passed by a trial court in Panchkula through which their application under Section 53-A of the Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC) for getting DNA profiling was dismissed. While dismissing their plea, the trial court had observed that the survivor, while stepping into the witness-box, had categorically stated every fact in sequence and now after recording her statement, both the accused have moved the applications, which were nothing but misuse of the process of law. A person cannot be allowed to move application at any stage he likes, the judge had observed. Aggrieved at this, the accused had approached the HC, submitting that the dismissal of their applications amounted to denial of fair trial. After hearing the petition, the HC observed that a criminal trial is a search of truth. “Therefore, a judge has to intervene as and when required, especially to rule out illegalities, irregularities or infirmities and also the inadmissible evidence. Under the provisions of Section 53-A of the CrPC, it is imperative for the prosecution to go in for DNA test. No cogent reason has been assigned by the trial court while dismissing the application,” observed the HC while setting aside the April 10 order. In July last year, a 21-year-old woman had alleged that she was held hostage in a guesthouse in Morni and gang raped by over 40 men. The case had hit national headlines, following which the Panchkula police suspended some officials for negligence in registering an FIR at the women’s police station. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Clay modelling workshop ends.description: CHANDIGARH: The Chandigarh Commission for Protection of Child Rights (CCPCR) in collaboration with Chandigarh Lalit Kala Akademi, organized a clay modelling workshop on the concluding day of art and design workshop for children of Snehalaya, Maloya.Bheem Malhotra, president, Chandigarh Lalit Kala Akademi, was the chief guest. Senior artist of the Tricity, Gurmeet Goldie and Kamal, were also present. Sanjeet Kumar and Jyoti, young sculptors of the Tricity, were the resource persons for the event. They gave a demonstration on clay modelling to children who created beautiful figures, models, landscapes and objects.Looking at the talent of the children, Malhotra offered to give them an opportunity at major workshops so that they could get exposure and excel in their skills. As many as 30 children of Snehalaya participated in the workshop. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Manimajra man dies, friend hurt in bike-.description: PANCHKULA: A Manimajra man lost his life and his friend was injured after a truck crashed into their motorcycle in Sector 7 on Thursday. Lallan Shah, 30, a labourer, said in his police complaint, “Around 1.15pm, I, along with my friend Pawan Chaudhary, 35, a resident of Indira Colony, was going from Panchkula to Manimajra. When we reached near a school in Sector 7, a truck (HP-24-C-3378) coming from the opposite direction rammed into our bike and ran over Pawan.” While Pawan died on the spot, passersby took an injured Lallan, also a resident of Manimajra, to civil hospital, Sector 6, from where he was referred to GMCH-32, Chandigarh. The police have registered a case under sections 279 (rash driving on public way), 337 (causing hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others) and 304-A (death caused due to negligence) of the Indian Penal Code. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Haryana: Vehicles painted fluorescent to.description: CHANDIGARH: To check the large number of road accidents that have almost become commonplace, the Haryana Police has come up with an innovative idea of using fluorescent paint on the rear of slow moving, stranded or illegally parked vehicles on highways. This drive has already been launched in Panipat district of Karnal range. Stating this here on Thursday, Additional Director General of Police (law and order) Navdeep Singh Virk said a number of accidents occur on highways, especially in the night, due to lack of reflectors on such vehicles, which leads to loss of precious human lives. The fluorescent painting on the rear of vehicles would help minimize the risks of accidents at night as it would alert and warn commuters about the presence of a vehicle ahead. “We are getting the rear of such vehicles painted with fluorescent colors in Panipat under the supervision of IG Karnal range. Karnal and Kaithal districts would be covered shortly and the project would later on be replicated in other ranges in collaboration with traffic and highways police,” Virk added. He said police will also launch a special drive to drill safety triangle reflectors on the rear of vehicles in Panipat and Karnal districts to cut down incidents related to fatal road accidents on highways. Mall Road caves in again, AMC blames PWD.description: Amritsar: A brief spell of pre-monsoon rain not only highlighted lack of preparedness of Amritsar Municipal Corporation (AMC) in dealing with waterlogging and sewerage choking during ensuing rainy days but also exposed the quality of its recently carried out repair work as a portion of city's prominent Mall Road again caved in on Thursday. Following the rain, a large pit was seen on Mall Road where AMC had in recent past spent around Rs 40 lakh to complete the repair work of a major portion of the road which had earlier caved in during last September. The spot is near the house of AMC’s commissioner. Former Congress spokesperson Mandeep Singh Manna demanded a case to be registered against AMC’s engineers and contractors who had carried out the repair work. “It’s unfortunate that once again the road has caved in at the same place where AMC had repaired it using tax payer’s money,” Manna said. He added that a case under section 307 (attempt to murder) of IPC should be registered against the persons responsible for gross negligence. In the walled city, Akali government’s dream project ‘Heritage Street’ was also submerged on Thursday causing inconvenience to the commuters and visitors alike and prompted locals to raise questions on AMC. Later, AMC joint commissioner, Nitish Singla, in a release, said, “Today’s cave in on the Mall Road has been caused due to the negligence of PWD officials who have failed to take proper care of restoration of the road.” Singla said an inquiry was conducted in January by the then joint commissioner AMC in which officers of PWD were found to have not performed their duty properly. “Spot report has again been taken today and departmental inquiry will be initiated against the ring officers,” said the joint commissioner. Superintendent engineer, PWD, couldn’t be contacted for comments. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kullu road accident.description: MANALI: At least 44 people have died and 29 sustained injured on Thursday when a bus fell into a gorge in Himachal's Kullu district. Kullu superintendent of police (SP) Shalini Agnihotri said several women and kids were among the injured. The vehicle had started its journey from the Banjar bus stand around 4pm and covered barely 2km when it met with an accident. The driver apparently lost control while negotiating a sharp turn at the Bhiyoth Mor, which has a gradient of more than 75 degrees. Eyewitnesses said the bus veered off the road to scrape the mountain face before hurtling down the gorge. Local residents and police personnel faced difficulty locating and extricating the bodies from the mangled mass of metal. Parts of the vehicle were strewn over a wide swathe of the bottom of the gorge. Between 2009 and 2018, Himachal Pradesh recorded 30,993 road accidents in which 11,561 people were killed and 53,909 injured. This year alone, as many as 430 people died in 1,168 road accidents in the state till May 31. Segregation of garbage a must, new set o.description: Panchkula: Municipal Corporation Panchkula is chalking out plans to upgrade its garbage collection and segregation in district. For the domestic house hold, which are more than one lakh under the MC limit in district, 100 carts will have two boxes to segregate the garbage which will be a reality by next month. At present as per the records of the MC there are 29 carts which are collecting the garbage from Panchkula district. There are 20 wards in Panchkula, four in Kalka and two in Pinjore. But as per this pilot project the MC initiated segregation in three wards which is 15, 16, 17 where the residents were asked to segregate garbage at house hold level and in case there is violation strict action will be taken under the law by the authorities.Rajesh Jogpal Administrator MC Panchkula said that wards which covers in first phase are ward 14 comprises Sector-14, Sector-12, 12A, village Railla and Railly, ward 15 comprises sectors Sector-10, 11 and ward 16 comprises of Sector-2, village Majri and Sector 4 including village Haripur Jarnail Singh executive officer of the municipal corporation said that the tender for the carts will be open on June 24 after which the authorities will have over three-fold for the district. He said that project will be commenced from Panchkula but in later phases it will be implemented in Kalka and Pinjore also. Sharing the awareness plans to make residents aware about the segregation he said that the carts will be collecting the garbage will have speakers installed in it. Through which the residents will made aware about the wet and dry waste. The authorities had distributed around 48,000 dustbins to the residents of the city for make them aware about the segregations which they are suppose to do in routine, he said. The officials have also laid down rules for penalties for non-segregation. On the first instance of default a warning will be issued by the MC to the house and the garbage will not be collected from the house if not segregated. On teh second such instance a challan will be issued by the MC as per norms. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Cheating: Chandigarh district court decl.description: CHANDIGARH: The Chandigarh district court has dismissed the complaint wherein allegations of cheating were made against the accused in case related to sale of land. Stating that the court could not act as an instrument in the hands of the complainant to summon every person against whom a complaint is filed, it dismissed the pliant for being devoid of merits and non existing of sufficient material on record. Jeewan Kumar Gupta of Sector 51 had filed a compliant against Rakesh Kumar, director of M/s Ess & Ess Polyfabs, stating that in June 2008 he was sold land measuring eight kanals to him and to one other person namely Sahil Mangla vide registered sale deed dated June 25, 2008. The complainant stated that he later got to know that litigation with respect to the said land was pending in the courts of law.He then approached the accused for return of his money but the accused refused to do do. Hence he move to court with prayer to summon the accused. The court stated, " Only vague allegations have been levelled by the complainant against the persons sought to be summoned. The very contents of complaint are evasive and do not help to give strength to the story put forth by complainant. It is pertinent to mention that mere assertions against are not sufficient to bring criminal law in motion.." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

High court lawyer seeks appointment of L.description: CHANDIGARH: Aggrieved over the delay in appointment of Lokpal in Punjab, RTI activist and high court lawyer H C Arora has sent a demand notice to the state government to fill the vacancy without further delay. The post of Punjab Lokpal is lying vacant for over one year. The post had fallen vacant last year after Justice S K Mittal, former Chief Justice of the Rajasthan High Court, resigned from the Punjab Lokpal’s post and joined as Chairman of the Human Rights Commission, Haryana. In his demand notice, advocate Arora has stated that there is a provision for appointment of Lokpal under the Punjab Lokpal Act, 1996, who has been given the jurisdiction to conduct inquiries against “public men” and also against public servants, in cases where they are also involved in the commission of misconduct by the public men. Public men include persons who hold or have held the office of a minister, a member of Legislative Assembly of the state, and chairmen and members of boards constituted by or under a state or central act. It can also probe the complaint of misconduct against the chairmen of certain government companies, chairman and a member of any non-statutory committee constituted by the state government, chairman and vice-chairman of Zila Parishad under the Punjab Panchayati Raj Act, 1994, including its officials, mayor, senior deputy mayor of a municipal corporation constituted under the Punjab Municipal Corporation Act, 1976, and officials and president and vice-president of a municipal council or nagar panchayat constituted under the Punjab Municipal Act, 1911. The Lokpal can probe their conduct to make recommendations to the state government for taking suitable action against them. “That notwithstanding the importance of the statutory post of Lokpal under the statute, the said post is lying vacant for the last more than one year, which cannot be justified. Thus, it is imperative on the part of the state to make appointment of a Lokpal, in consultation with the Chief Justice of the Punjab and Haryana High Court, without any further delay,” Arora has requested the state government. In the demand notice, Arora, however, has also made it clear that if no decision is taken by the Punjab government in appointing Lokpal within one month, he would file a public interest litigation seeking immediate appointment to Lokpal’s post. Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. International Yoga Day 2019: PM urges country to embrace Yoga"We should make efforts to take yoga from cities to villages and tribal areas. Yoga is above religion, caste, colour, gender and region, it is above everything," he told the gathering. Yoga is ancient and modern. It is constant and evolving. For centuries, the essence of Yoga has remained the same… https://t.co/isvMOUTrn8— PMO India (@PMOIndia) 1561080804000The main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Best pictures from International Yoga Day 2019"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Follow live updates: International Yoga DayThe main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Amit Shah credits PM for taking yoga to the world"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Car driver injures traffic cop near Elan.description: CHANDIGARH: Industrial Area police booked a car driver for injuring a traffic head constable near Elante mall on Thursday. The cop had tried to stop him as he was talking on phone while driving. In his complaint, head constable Narinder Singh said he was posted along with a constable at Elante mall to manage traffic around 4.30pm. He noticed a white car driver coming towards him while talking on cellphone. The windows of the car also had a black film and a woman was sitting next to him, the cop added. He said he signalled him to stop, but the accused revved up. The head constable chased him on his bike. After a few metres, he intercepted him and stopped the car. The head constable stood in front of the car and asked the driver to come out. Suddenly, the accused pressed the accelerator. In a bid to save himself, the head constable jumped to the other side and received minor injuries. The car driver managed to flee the spot and the injured cop called up at 100 helpline. He was taken to GMCH-32 and later Industrial Area Phase-1 police recorded his statement and registered a case under sections 279 (rash driving), 332 (voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty) and 353 (assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty) of the IPC against the car driver. All-clear for bridge over Ghaggar.description: PANCHKULA: Decks have been cleared for the construction of bridge over Ghaggar river in sectors 26-27 and 20-21 in Panchkula. The Punjab Government has in-principle approved the construction of this bridge and connecting road which falls in the jurisdiction of Haryana. With the construction of this bridge, the long pending demand of the people of the area would be fulfilled. This was informed in the meeting presided over by chief minister, Manohar Lal Khattar here on Wednesday. It was informed that the matter regarding the construction of this bridge was being taken up in co-ordination with the neighbouring Punjab Government. A portion of this proposed bridge falls in Punjab. The CM also directed the HSVP to explore the possibilities of construction of a road linking the NH-73 and International Airport in Chandigarh so as to provide direct connectivity to the people of Barwala, Raipur Rani and Naraingarh. Among those present in the meeting included Chief Secretary D S Dhesi, Principal Secretary to Chief Minister Rajesh Khullar, Additional Chief Secretary Animal Husbandry and Dairying Sunil Kumar Gulati, Additional Chief Secretary Power and Works related to implementation of C M announcements T C Gupta, Principal Secretary Science and Technology Ashok Khemka, Principal Secretary Town and Country Planning and Urban Estates Department A K Singh, Principal Secretary Social Justice and Empowerment and Welfare of Scheduled Castes and Backward Classes Departments Neerja Sekhar. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nA peep into Haryanavi culture\n.description: Candigarh Sangeet Natak Akademi in collaboration with Haryana Kala Parishad organized Daaman Ki Phatkar- The Mirror of Haryanvi culture.
