Quick response team to make highways and.description: PANCHKULA: Panchkula Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) held a meeting 25 riders who were appointed on the newly appointed Quick Response Team (QRT) motorcycles. 13 riders have been assigned duties on highway while 12 riders were asked to patrol in the city to tackle snatching related issues. As per the directived of the DCP, Kamaldeep Goyal, QRT teams means to reach at every assignment given to them on time. The 13 riders team who has been appointed the road safety have been asked to respond to any accident related spot well on time soon after the call reaches to them. The highway traffic jams should be helped by the QRT highway teams. Besides this, the team appointed for the city has been asked to patrol in different areas on different shifts so that crimes like snatching and other crimes can be avoided. The DCP has given all the QRT riders a designated area which will be taken care by them in case of any emergency. DCP said, "The QRT officials will also help the accident victims during any accident on all the highways crossing through the district and also in curbing down the petty crime rate in the city." Haryana director general of police (DGP) Manoj Yadava on Monday launched 25 special motorcycles at the Sector 14 police station. These bikes will assist the Panchkula police commissionerate QRT to provide road safety. The new motorcycles have been added to traffic unit of Panchkula under the initiative. The QRT team was flagged off by Haryana DGP along with Panchkula police commissioner (CP) Saurabh Singh and deputy commissioner of police (DCP) Kamaldeep Goyal. The motorcycles equipped with sirens and flash lights have been given by a private company as per its corporate social responsibility) initiative. Harbhajan Singh, director of the private company manufacturing the motorcycles, was also present on the occasion. There are 28 PCR and 26 motorcycle riders deployed in the district day and night for crime control. Now, the addition of these 25 new motorcycles in district police will further aid in controlling the crime effectively, officials said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Three years, 88 FIRs later, illegal mini.description: MOHALI: Illegal mining has been rampant and despite seizures of JCBs and tipper trucks, mining activities have continued unabated in in Khizrabad, Mullanpur, Parol, Majri, Abhipur, Lubhangarh, Tiur, Mianpur Changran, Kubaheri, Gochar, Kansala, Bahalpur Tiprian and Kharar areas of Mohali despite the fact that in July last year, deputy commissioner raided the Khizrabad area and found 40 illegal crushers operating from the site. Villagers led by Jagdev Singh Maloya, an AAP activist presented a memorandum in this regard to deputy commissioner Girish Dayalan on Thursday. He along with Sunder Singh, Darshan Singh, Sudagar Singh, Hardev Singh, Ram Singh, Pritam Singh and others alleged that there has been no action against illegal miners who have been flanked by some political leaders which is harming the environment of the area. They also alleged in memorandum that four mining and forest department employees were also allegedly attacked by illegal miners and two of them are still critical. The residents living in such areas wished that Chief Minister Amarinder Singh must fly past over Kandi area of Mohali as well to have first-hand stock of illegal mining taking place in the district. Demanding action, residents said that chief minister of Punjab is not updated about the illegal activity undergoing in villages in Kandi area . Last year, the CM flew past Jalandhar and Nawanshahar district to spot illegal mining going in Sutlej river beds from his chopper. The very next day the government launched massive crackdown on the illegal mining in the state The special task force constituted by deputy commissioner to check the illegal mining activity failed to bring about any results as the entire exercise turns futile after the task force returned empty handed every time after conducting the checking of the area. 13 Barnala farmers fail to get debt waiv.description: BARNALA: Theirs is a queer case of alive, yet dead. Put in category of ‘dead’ by the village multipurpose agricultural cooperative society, 13 small and marginal farmers of Badbar village in Barnala district have been struggling hard for the last six months to prove their existence and avail the benefit under Punjab government’s debt relief scheme. Out of these 13 farmers, three held a protest outside the society office on Thursday, demanding justice. During these six months, these farmers have provided all the relevant documents, including Aadhaar cards, to prove themselves as alive but have still failed to convince the cooperative society to change their status from ‘dead’ to ‘alive’. Meanwhile, the officials claim that the farmers had initially failed to provide their Aadhaar cards and were to be put in the category of ‘not available’ but mistakenly got clubbed in the category of ‘dead’ by the cooperative society. Interestingly, this group of 13 includes Gurmukh Singh, who had prevailed upon a score of villagers to fill forms for getting compensation. Speaking to TOI, Gurmukh said, “When the debt waiver process began in the village, I had filled forms of many farmers. Nearly six months ago, the cooperative society officials told me that my name had mistakenly been entered in the list of ‘dead’ and told to submit documents to prove that I was still alive. I deposited the relevant documents and was told that my name has been deleted from the list of ‘dead’. Now, about a week back, the cooperative society officials again called me, saying my name continues in the list of ‘dead’ and asked for documents again.” “I know that there are 12 others persons from my village who have also been shown as ‘dead’ and denied the debt waiver benefit. I have even approached the SDM in Barnala and requested him to instruct the cooperative department to set the record straight so that we (13) may also get the government assistance. But nothing has been done so far. I own 4 acres of land and am eligible for waiver of Rs 46,826,’’ he said. Another aggrieved farmer Jarnail Singh, who also owns 4 acre land and is eligible to get waiver of Rs 52,544, claimed, “I provided all the documents to prove I was alive. Besides, everyone in the village cooperative society is well aware that I am not dead. I keep meeting them; yet remain in the category of ‘dead’. I am still struggling to get my status changed.” Another marginal farmer Sukhwant Singh, who owns a oneacre landholding and is eligible for Rs 29,070 waiver, said, “For me, even this (Rs 29,070) amount means a lot as there is hardly any earning from the land and I am not in a position to repay the loan.” Cooperative society secretary Jeet Singh said they had received a list from the assistant registrar’s office nearly six months ago and it showed over 30 people as dead, when they were actually alive. “At a camp held at Kotduna village near here, I had informed the officials about the error and had provided the Aadhaar cards of these 30 people. I had even uploaded the Aadhaar cards on the official portal. After some time, the status of 17 beneficiaries changed, but 13 remained as ‘dead’ and they remain so despite me providing the Aadhaar cards again. Only a week ago, we got the list again — showing them as ‘dead’,” he said. Barnala SDM Sandeep Kumar, when contacted, said, “We are trying to ascertain whose fault it is. An inquiry has been marked, to be conducted by the deputy registrar of cooperative societies, to find out how these living persons have been shown as dead and denied the benefits for which they are eligible. Whosoever is found guilty, appropriate action will be taken in the matter and the record will be set right.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PU departments, colleges asked to ensure.description: CHANDIGARH: Various departments of Panjab University and colleges affiliated to it have been asked to ensure that no seat goes vacant in the upcoming admission season. At a meeting of the dean university instructions (DUI), Shankarji Jha, with chairpersons and representatives of departments and colleges on Thursday, the DUI told all stakeholders to reach out to students via social media and emails and ensure maximum admissions. Professor Jha said, as per suggestions given in the meeting, the university may extend the last date of applications and permit late admissions with late fees if it found that seats were not filled. "The admissions are just a few days away. We discussed strategies through which all colleges and departments can reach out to students and make it an easy experience for them," Jha said. The last date for applying to PU is July 3. Admission fees will be accepted from July 15. Late admissions can be taken with permissions of the chairpersons of the departments and vice-chancellor after submitting a late fee of Rs 1,000 and 3,000 till August 31. As per the indications of the meeting, if seats go vacant, the deadlines would be further extended. Sources present in the meeting said they were told that for post-graduate admissions, the faculties were told to contact the undergraduate students of their departments. The faculty has also been asked to be active on social media and give updates about their departments to students. For guidance, the faculty members have been asked to be present in their respective departments between 3 and 4 pm on working days so that candidates can reach out to them for more information. The officials have also been told to set up help desks where students can reach out to inquire about admission formalities and procedures. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Punjab: Two crore saplings distributed f.description: CHANDIGARH: The Punjab government distributed around two crore saplings free of cost last year under Mission Tandarust Punjab, said forest minister Sadhu Singh Dharamsot on Thursday. Dharamsot said that 10,000 hectares of land has been brought under forest cover with the planting of 1.3 crore saplings, whereas in accordance with the “Ghar Ghar Hariyali” campaign around 68 lakh saplings have been distributed free of cost to the people. The forest minister added that a target has been set to plant 550 saplings in every village of Punjab as part of the 550th birth anniversary celebrations of Guru Nanak Dev. The plan would see 75 lakh saplings being planted, he added. Dharamsot said to date, around 2,000 villages out of over 13,000 have been covered under the plantation drive. He said that saplings are being prepared in more than 200 nurseries of the forest department. As per the anti-encroachment campaign undertaken by the forest department, to date 5,000 acre land has been freed from illegal encroachers and the drive to plant saplings on this land is under process. Dharamsot also said that under a special scheme, four lakh saplings of vegetables were distributed absolutely free. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Only 1,400 of more than 15,000 Class 11.description: CHANDIGARH: The recent provisional common merit list uploaded by the UT education department on June 18 shows that out of 15, 931 students, who had applied for admission to Class XI at government schools in Chandigarh, around 1,400 applied for skill courses as their first preference. “A stream-wise provisional merit list was prepared on the basis of first preference given by candidates. As per the list, less than 1,400 students have applied for skill courses as their first preference,” an official of the department said. Meanwhile, breaking the myth that skill courses are for students, who are weak in academics, many students with more than 70% marks have applied for skill courses. In over 12 course combinations out of 18, many students with 70% and above have applied. Many students with over 90% marks have applied for fashion studies, textile design, design and information technology and web applications. As per the stream-wise provisional merit list, information technology and web applications remained the preferred courses wit 371 applicants. As many as 257 applied for shorthand (hindi), office procedures and practices and typography and computer applications. Only 140 students opted for beauty, wellness and yoga skills. Around 126 applied for fashion studies and textile design. A total of 15,931 students, who had applied for Class XI admission in government schools made it to the first provisional common merit list uploaded on the website of the UT education department on June 18. Total eligible students in science, commerce and humanities are 3,157, 2,243 and 9,124, respectively. Temaining 1,407 students have been considered eligible for different vocational courses and sports. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

City-based builder fined Rs 5 Lakh for n.description: CHANDIGARH: State consumer disputes redressal commission directed Soni Builders in Sector 44, Chandigarh, to pay Rs 1.44 crore along with interest to four persons for failing to give timely possession of the flat booked. The builder was also directed to pay Rs 1 lakh as compensation to them and Rs 22,000 as litigation cost to three complainants and Rs 33,000 as litigation to fourth complainant. The commission proposed to dispose four complaints through a single order, as the issues involved therein, except minor variations, were the same. In all the four complaints, prayer had been made to give directions to the builder to refund the deposited amount, along with interest, compensation etc. At the time of arguments, on April 29, it was agreed by the contesting parties that the four complaints can be disposed of by passing a consolidated order. According to the commission, the complainants had purchased flats in a project launched by the builder, called KSB Greens in Gazipur Road, Zirakpur, Punjab. However despite making payment, the builder failed to deliver possession of the unit, which otherwise was supposed to have been handed over on or before December 2015. The builder stated that the buyers purchased the flats for future gain, as such, the complainants being investors, would not fall within the definition of consumer, as defined under Section 2 (1) (d) of the Consumer Protection Act, 1986. But the forum held that it is not in dispute that the complainants purchased the flats in the aforesaid project of the builders. It was also not disputed that by the time these complaints were filed, possession of the units was not offered to the complainants, which otherwise was to be handed over on or before December 2015, as stipulated in Clause 10 of the Agreement to Sell. The forum further added that it is a simple case of non-delivery of possession of the unit by the committed date, despite receiving substantial amount from the complainants. The builder was then directed to pay up to all four complainants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman thrashed, forced into car, cops pr.description: CHANDIGARH: The kidnapping of a woman from Ram Darbar has kept the police on their toes. According to an eye-witness who called the police, a man allegedly forced a woman into his car after thrashing her in public. Sector 31 police are investigating the case. Raj Kumar, a resident of Ram Darbar, reported that a man and a woman were abusing each other near his house at around 9am. Soon, the man started thrashing her in full public view. Then he dragged her to his car and forced her into it and drove away. The woman was screaming for help and reluctant to go with him, eye witness told police. The cops from Sector 31 police station reached the spot and recorded the statement of Raj Kumar, who also provided half noted registration number of the car used for abduction. The police said that they were verifying the incident and efforts are on to trace the car and the accused. Sector 31 police have lodged a DDR. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Villages with population below 10,000 ca.description: CHANDIGARH: The Haryana government has decided that villages having a population of less than 10,000 but desirous of having more facilities like augmentation of water supply and sewerage would be covered under the Mahagram B category. A decision to this effect was taken in the 52nd meeting of the Water Supply and Sewerage Board, which met under the chairmanship of chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday. Minister of state for public health engineering Banwari Lal was also present in the meeting. The chief minister said that at present 126 villages with over 10,000 people were being covered under the Mahagram Yojana. Facilities like augmentation of water supply, sewerage, and setting up sewerage treatment plant were being provided under the scheme. He said recently, people of various villages had approached him with a request to carry out development works in their villages also under the scheme, for which they had also offered to contribute funds. He also directed that besides providing training to sewermen, they should also be provided with necessary equipment, uniform, and kit so as to prevent any untoward incident of suffocation while cleaning the sewer. He directed that only trained sewermen should be allowed to enter manholes. It was informed that the training of 703 sewermen had been held in different locations covering 14 circles of the Public Health Engineering department. It was also informed that three robotic machines were being purchased by the department for cleaning manholes. On the successful trial run of these machines, more of them would be purchased. Cleaners\u2019 stir over union president.description: CHANDIGARH: Safai karamcharis on Thursday ended their protest following the municipal corporation commissioner’s assurance that their union president’s suspension will be looked into. The safai karamcharis’ union along with other UT federations held a demonstration outside MC’s office from 11am to 2pm. Later, they met commissioner KK Yadav. “The commissioner assured us that he would revoke the suspension. He has asked us to meet him in two days,” said protesting union members. The civic body had on Tuesday suspended Krishan Chadha for misbehaving with mayor Rajesh Kumar Kalia during an official meeting on June 13. According to the suspension orders, Chadha has to report daily at the medical officer health office in Sector 17 and not leave without prior permission. Meanwhile, MC’s initiative to start door-to-door garbage collection at source was only implemented in four UT villages. The MC is yet to finalize terms and conditions with collectors for starting the drive in urban areas too. The civic body had decided to segregate garbage at the source itself as the Supreme Court had issued directions to implement the Municipal Solid Waste Rules, 2016. Besides, the National Green Tribunal (NGT) is also monitoring solid waste management cases. Last year, the garbage collection and segregation were majorly hit after the strike. The segregation of waste into wet, dry and hazardous is mandatory at household level under the Municipal Solid Waste Rules, 2016, recently adopted by the Chandigarh administration. The bone of contention between the MC and garbage collectors was control over income after segregation of waste. While the MC is ready to provide jobs to private collectors on DC rates, along with benefits of provident fund and ESI, there is no consensus between both the parties over how the income after segregation will be distributed. But recently, the garbage collectors had agreed to help the civic body in segregation. The other modalities of memorandum of understanding between the MC and the collectors will be finalized by a panel formed by the MC commissioner. Punjab \u2018agent\u2019 dupes man of Rs.description: CHANDIGARH: The police have registered a case of cheating and under the Immigration Act against a Punjab resident for duping a local of around Rs 8.5 lakh on the pretext of sending him abroad. No arrest has been made so far. Manoj Kumar of Manimajra alleged that Kamlajit, a resident of Hoshiarpur who introduced himself as a travel agent, took money from him for arranging a Canada work permit. Manoj said the accused visited his house and convinced him to pay Rs 13 lakh to send him to Canada last year. The complainant agreed to initially pay Rs 8.5 lakh and said he would pay the remaining amount on reaching Canada. The complainant deposited money in Kamlajit’s account between September and October last year. The complaint said the accused sent him Canada air tickets, but made him stay in a hotel in Delhi for a month, citing a legal problem in his visa. To win the complainant’s faith, the accused deposited Rs 5,000 in his account for the stay in Delhi hotel. Later, the accused told the complaint that the official who was dealing with his case had expired and so he could not be sent and his ticket had been cancelled. Later, Manoj visited Delhi embassy and learnt that the photocopy of the visa he was carrying was fake. He complained to the UT police in January last and after taking legal opinion, Manimajra police registered a case. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. \nNGO organizes fund raiser for special.description: Model and actress, Neet Mahal was in town recently to take part in a fund raiser event for special children. In the event, she was joined by Gagan Verma, Mr Supermodel Universe, Ruby Singh, actor and model and fitness expert Dr Vibha Bawa, winner of North Indian Queen 2018 and Ayurveda expert Sanjana Sharma, ex-banker and Mrs. India Beauty Queen 2018, Dr Tetiana Kapranova an endocrinologist, therapist and fashion model, Sam Rattan, actor-model and anchor, Dr Rimple Sharma, Mrs. Chandigarh Queen 2018. ‘Elysian Diva’, the fund raiser event was organized by Empower, a city based project, which works for special children betterment in association with Surkhwabh. The event was also a tribute to the supreme sacrifice of Deputy Commandant Joy Lal whose 20 th martyrdom day falls on May 30. During occasion, around dozen special children walked the ramp along with celebrities. Wheelchair Indian Cricket team players including Ranjit Singh, Nirmal Singh and Veer Singh Sandhu also joined kids in ramp walk and show. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandigarh: On-duty traffic cops found s.description: CHANDIGARH: As many as 12 traffic cops were caught napping in an air-conditioned dormitory of Himachal Bhawan in Sector 28 on Thursday afternoon. Senior police officers have initiated inquiry into the matter. Traffic police cops were caught while sleeping during duty hours. Charanjit Singh, PRO, UT police, said that they were investigating the matter. “Strict action would be taken against erring policemen,” he added. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" \nPhilosophical perspective of Ganga thr.description: Pracheen Kala Kendra organized a spectacular dance ballet ‘Ganga’ by the students of Kendra in the direction of Kathak exponent Dr. Samira Koser at Tagore Theatre. There were about 80 participants between the ages of 5 to 55, who gave ample proof of training given bytheir Guru Koser. This programme was split in two parts, one was Dance ballet Ganga and other, pure kathak dance presentations of Jaipur Gharana. After the lighting of traditional lamp, the programme got a majestic start with Ganga. This dance ballet gives a message that we should awaken and purify Ganga as well as our souls and be good human beings before it’s too late. This ballet was presented by Shubhra Koser, Amrita, Anu, Divya, Mehak, Savitri, Tanaya, Sonika, anushka, Geetika, Pranjal , Ojaswita , Sargam and Gursimran. CBI grills another Punjab transport offi.description: CHANDIGARH: Continuing with their investigation in a graft case, CBI officials on Thursday interrogated another Punjab transport officer for more than five hours. After recovering stamps of the Punjab CM from the house of accused Bhupinder Singh, the CBI has expedited his investigation in the case. Sources in CBI said assistant transport officer, Punjab, Sukhwinder Singh Brar was on Thursday summoned by the CBI for investigation in the case. A special CBI court on Wednesday had remanded Punjab assistant transport officer Bhupinder Singh to two-day police custody in the bribe case. The CBI had on June 18 arrested Bhupinder Singh for allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs 20,000 from a truck driver in Sector 23. CBI stated that complainant Punam Chand of Bikaner, Rajasthan, was going to deliver marbles and tiles at Dhanas with his driver Ramdev on the night of June 14. As they were about to reach the market, a Toyota Innova SUV intercepted and signalled them to stop. A man in police uniform introduced himself as Bhupinder Singh and demanded the truck documents. When the driver handed over him the original documents, Bhupinder took them away . Chand alleged the accused demanded Rs 25,000 for releasing the original documents . The deal was finally settled at Rs 20,000. Chand, in the meantime, lodged a complainant with the CBI. CBI sleuths laid a trap near the house of the accused and as Chand handed over the amount to Bhupinder, they caught him. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Punjab delegation seeks one-time resolut.description: CHANDIGARH: The Meghalaya government has assured the Punjab government delegation to protect the interests of people of all communities living in the state. The delegation, led by Punjab jails minister Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa, met Meghalaya home minister James K Sangma on Thursday and urged him to ensure amicable one-time resolution to the lingering issue of Sikh settlers in Shillong. The delegation had reached Shillong on Wednesday, after a radical outfit, Hynniewtrep National Liberation Council (HNLC), recently threatened the Sikh settlers in Punjabi Lane area. The delegation also requested the committee formed by the Meghalaya government to take into account the genuine concerns of Sikh families before reaching any conclusion. It also requested Sangma to ensure security to hundreds of Sikh families residing in the Punjabi Lane area of Shillong for decades. Taking up the issue of notices issued by Shillong municipal board to Sikh settlers to prove ownership of their land, the delegation urged Sangma to remove any apprehension from the minds of the community. It said that any arbitrary action of evacuation would be in gross violation of the right to movement and freedom of the Sikh community. Assuring protection of Sikhs in Meghalya, Sangma informed the delegation that though HNLC was defunct, the state government had already made elaborate security arrangements to protect the fundamental rights of all the people. He also spoke to Punjab chief minister Amarinder Singh on phone and assured all possible help by his government to the settlers. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two Nigerians among three held with hero.description: CHANDIGARH: The police have arrested three drug peddlers, including two Nigerians, with heroin from different parts of the city in the past 24 hours. A police party was patrolling on the Sector 36A and B dividing road on Thursday noon. On seeing the cops, a man tried to flee. He was, however, chased and nabbed. He identified himself as Raphael, 20, a resident of Nigeria. During checking, 82 grams of heroin was found on him. He was arrested after the seizure. A few hours before, around 9.30am, police had caught another Nigerian near Industrial Area, Phase II. After 267 grams of heroin was found on John, 24, cops arrested him under the NDPS Act. Police said the accused would be produced before courts to seek their remand. They would be questioned about the source of drugs and their clientele. “We are also checking their visas,” said a cop. The third such case was reported on Wednesday night. A man tried to flee on seeing a checkpoint in Sarangpur. Cops chased him and during frisking found 10-gram heroin on the man, who identified himself as Gaurav. He was produced before a local court that sent him to judicial custody. H1B Visa news.description: WASHINGTON: The Trump administration has no plans to cap H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally, the state department said on Thursday. Reuters reported on Wednesday that the United States had told India it was considering restricting the H-1B visa programmes for countries with the data storage requirement. The H-1B programme issues US visas to skilled foreign workers. US mulling 15% cap on H-1B visa for Indians"The Trump Administration has no plans to place caps on H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally," a state department spokeswoman said in a statement in response to the Reuters article. While an administration's "Buy American Hire American" executive order calls for a broad review of US worker visa programs, including the H-1B programme, it was not targeted at a specific country, the spokeswoman said. It is "completely separate from our ongoing discussions with India about the importance of ensuring the free flow of data across borders," the spokeswoman added. Earlier on Thursday, India said it was in talks with the United States on H-1B visas, but foreign ministry spokesman Raveesh Kumar told a news conference: "We have not heard anything officially from the US government" on capping such permits for Indians. US secretary of state Mike Pompeo is scheduled to visit New Delhi next week for talks that will include areas of disagreement between the two countries over trade. H-1B cap for India? It’s not easy and may need approval by US Congress, say expertsTwo senior Indian officials told Reuters on Wednesday they had been briefed last week on a US plan to cap the number of H-1B visas given annually to Indians at between 10% and 15% of the total number issued. There is no country-specific limit on the 85,000 H-1B work visas the United States issues every year, and an estimated 70% of them go to Indians. QS ranking not significant, say Panjab U.description: CHANDIGARH: With QS shutting out Panjab University (PU) out of its global 1000 ranking list, the university officials have maintained that the ranking was not significant for them. Professor Rajivlochan, former director of Internal Quality Assurance Cell (IQAC) at PU, said the "academic reputation", one of the components carrying maximum (40%) weightage in deciding QS ranking, was subjective. "The evaluation is not transparent. We do not know who all are being interviewed by the QS in chalking out our academic reputation score," he said while maintaining that Panjab University not diversifying in research and not investing in outreach was equally responsible in the rank drop. From 701+ rank in 2017, the university has dropped out from the global top 1000 university list for the second time this year. PU's present IQAC director professor Ashish Jain said they were happy at another rankings that were also released on Wednesday. "In the NTU rankings, we have outperformed all Indian universities. NTU rankings are significant for us because it compares the scientific performance of world universities based entirely on academic publications from three perspectives: research productivity, research impact and research excellence. QS rankings on the other hand does not give enough weightage to research and citations. Also, there were other factors that were not in our control," he said. Former vice-chancellor of PU professor Arun Kumar Grover said Indian universities always performed bad in QS rankings. "Except for IITs and IISc, which are institutions and not universities, QS rankings have not been good for any Indian university as such. PU used to be in top 1000 but it was ranked low there in the list as well. The type of evaluation QS does is not really suitable for Indian universities," he said. The officials said the real test of the university would be two years later in NAAC rankings, wherein their own students and faculty members would be asked to assess the university on various factors. "Right now, we don't know who is assessing us and how. But in NAAC rankings, if we score poor, we will at least know that we are not doing things right for our own students and faculty. That will be the real parameter to judge the university," said another official, who did not wish to be named. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. Punjab SC panel orders action against pr.description: CHANDIGARH: The Punjab State Scheduled Caste Commission on Thursday directed the additional chief secretary, higher education, to act against the Punjab Group of Colleges, Chunni Kalan, for illegally collecting admission fee from schedule caste students. The commission acted on a complaint filed by Jatinder Singh and other students alleging that the college was illegally collecting admission fee from schedule caste students who were doing BEd and MEd from there. The commission sought report from the departments concerned and found the allegations to be true. Commission chairperson Tejinder Kaur termed the matter as serious, saying that stated by charging admission fee the college was diluting the purpose of the post-matric scholarship scheme to help poor SC students pursue higher education. She said the higher education department has also been asked to submit a compliance report in the matter. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Le Corbusier furniture thieves have stru.description: CHANDIGARH: Miscreants had managed to steal heritage furniture three times from Le Corbusier Centre in Sector 19, Government College of Arts in Sector 10, and boys’ hostel in Sector 15 in the years 2015 and 2016. The UT police had claimed to have solved all three cases by arresting women and junk dealers from different parts of the city. Also, name of an industrialist had surfaced in the case, but no arrests were made. Later, three woman accused in the Le Carbusier Centre theft were acquitted by the district court after the police jfailed to make the case. Theft of eight V-shaped cushion chairs and two tables from Le Corbusier Centre on September 23, 2015, had hits the headlines. Later, a security guard had allegedly committed suicide and his family had alleged harassment by cops behind his taking the extreme step. They had also staged a protest outside Sector 19 police station with his body. After five months, the cops managed to arrest three women, Rekha, Seema and Hasheena — all residents of a colony in Sector 25, and claimed to recover stolen furniture from their houses. On April 19, 2017, the police failed to prove the case in the court and as a result, all three women were acquitted. Second theft of heritage furniture took place at Government College of Arts in Sector 10 on the night of January 18, 2016. Thieves managed to take away 15 heritage chairs and a table designed by Le Corbusier from the college storeroom. The Sector 3 police had registered a case against unknown persons. During investigation, the police arrested Sunil Kumar of Sector 25 and Faquir Chand of Kansal on February 3, 2016, and recovered 10 heritage chairs from them. Both Sunil and Faquir are junk dealers. Later police had also arrested two rag pickers Sweety and Shakila of Sector 25. According to the cops, Faqir was the mastermind behind the theft as he used to participate in furniture auctions in Punjab and Haryana. Third theft occurred in Sector 15 boys’ hostel in which four heritage chairs were stolen on October 9, 2016. However, after 15 days, Sector-11 police claimed to crack the case by arresting four persons. The police said two of the ccused had sold the chairs to an industrialist for Rs 88,000. AirAsia fined Rs 2 lakh for flight cance.description: CHANDIGARH: The district consumer disputes redressel forum has directed AirAsia to pay Rs 2 lakh as compensation for harassment along with Rs 11,000 as litigation cost to a city-based doctor. The airlines has also been directed to refund the air ticket amount of Rs 4,025. In his complaint Dr Virendra Singh, a resident of sector 21, had stated that on September 6, 2018, he reached New Delhi at about 3.50am to board a flight to Chandigarh that was to depart at 5:55am. He checked in his luggage and was issued a boarding pass. He and other passengers were seated in the flight, but the said flight never took off and he was made to wait for several hours in the aeroplane and on enquiry, no satisfactory answer was given to him and other passengers by the crew members. Being mentally tortured for around one and half hours, the passengers were told to get off the aeroplane without assigning any reason. After waiting for about one hour at the airport, the staff/employee told them that the departure time of the flight had been revised and new boarding passes would be issued to them. However, no exact time of departure was conveyed. After collecting the earlier boarding passes, new boarding passes were issued whereby boarding time was changed to 8 am. However, the flight again got delayed contrary and the passengers were again made to wait for a couple of hours. At around 10:45 am, the complainant and other passengers seated in the flight that did not take off. The passengers were told to depart from the aeroplane at about 12:30pm without assigning any reason. Finding no other alternative, the complainant purchased a new air ticket for his journey from New Delhi issued by Jet Airways for Rs 4,025. It has further been averred that he had to undergo great stress as he was repeatedly contacted by his staff for giving clarifications to ailing patients and supplying upgradations in lieu of new appointment timings. In its reply the airline stated that the first flight was cancelled due to technical reasons as the aircraft had developed technical snag and required immediate check up before flying. It added that technical experts tried their best to get it fixed up but could not and it took more than two hours and even more to get it rectified but the same was not sort out and as such the flight was cancelled and all the passengers were requested to re-board the aircraft and wait in the lounge area till further orders. It has further been pleaded that another flight, which the complainant later boarded, also did not take off as the same had just arrived from other destination and was not thoroughly checked up as the aircraft was not ready to fly because of refilling of gas that required two hours and for other technical checkups before take off. It was further pleaded that there was no other aircraft available with the airline as all flights were scheduled to fly at their destinations and as such the complainant was asked if he could share the taxi with others till Chandigarh, which he refused, therefore, his luggage was returned and he chose to come back to Chandigarh by Jet Airways flight. The forum, after hearing both sides, stated that no report regarding any technical defects/snags in the aircraft has been placed on record. Mere mentioning that the flights were cancelled due to technical snags could not be considered sufficient explanation to exempt the airlines from its liability. It was then directed to pay up. Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Ask SGPC to join government event: Amari.description: CHANDIGARH: Punjab chief minister Amarinder Singh has directed the group of ministers (GoM) to ask Shiromani Gurdwara Prabandhak Committee (SGPC) to support the state government’s celebration of 550th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev on a common platform. The chief minister also empowered GoM, comprising tourism and cultural affairs minister Charanjit Singh Channi, medical education and research minister OP Soni, and cooperation minister Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa to extend a formal invite to the Akal Takhat jathedar and the SGPC president. Water crisis, waste management worries c.description: CHANDIGARH: To review the progress of work which the commissioner of the Chandigarh municipal corporation assured to the members of the Chandigarh Residents Associations' Welfare Federation (Crawfed) two months ago, a meeting on the same will be held on June 23. In the monthly meeting, the MC commissioner, K K Yadav, will interface with the members of various resident welfare associations (RWAs) and respond to their queries. Hitesh Puri, chairman, Crawfed, said the main issues which the residents faced were water crisis and irregularities in garbage collection and its segregation by the MC staff. He said besides this, the commissioner would also respond to the issues which were raised earlier during a meeting in March. A 11-point memorandum was submitted by Crawfed to the MC commissioner during the meeting which was held in March. Various RWAs also submitted their sector specific issues to the commissioner. The members said it was impossible for the visitors to visit the apni mandi during the rainy season, which was set up in various sectors of the city. They proposed that tiles should be installed and concrete washrooms should be constructed at the site. Majority of the resident welfare associations (RWAs) suggested that sterilization of stray dogs should be done in one go instead of in phases, which makes it ineffective. They complained that residents avoid visit to neighbourhood parks due to large number of stray dogs as fear prevailed among walkers. Complaining about the practice of releasing payments to the contractors without monitoring the quality of work, the members recommended that the officials should visit the site to ensure execution and compliance of work in a proper manner. They suggested that regular maintenance of the community centres in the city and open gyms installed in the neighbourhood parks should be done by the municipal corporation (MC) so that the residents could utilize it properly. The Chandigarh Residents Associations' Wefare Federation (Crawfed) raised an issue to allocate booths In Sectors 17 and 22, which had been lying vacant since long and were in a shambles. Mohali: Sector 71 sabzi mandi has turned.description: By: Jaspreet Arora MOHALI: No doubt that apni mandis are a boon to both buyers and sellers. Weekly once - or twice - these mandis make it possible for the residents of various sectors and colonies to get fresh veggies and fruits at reasonable prices, from, say about 12 noon, to sometimes till midnight. But the fallout of this is that the sellers tend to dump a whole lot of leftovers, when they call it a day. The residents of the locality end up dealing with the resulting consequences of these. Usually, they take in their stride a few disadvantages, given the benefits that they enjoy. But sometimes, like in the case of Sector 71 sabzi mandi, the consequences overweigh the benefits, leaving behind disgruntled residents. Now, it is here that the municipal corporation (MC) should butt in and ensure that public hygiene and safety are not compromised. But when they turn a deaf ear, the situation explodes sooner or later. Like it has happened in Sector 71. On the one hand, the sabzi mandi here is quite popular and are held twice a week - Tuesdays and Saturdays - drawing in quite a crowd. On the other hand, its popularity has become detrimental to the locals living here. They complain that over time the green waste left behind by buyers have accumulated into a mass and has started to stink unbearably. The problem has exacerbated because people from nearby areas have taken to dumping their everyday garbage here. Residents say trollies, tractors and redis come full with garbage and dump them here. Despite repeated pleas to the MC, there is no one to keep a check on this. Naturally, the overflowing garbage has become a constant source of supply for foraging stray animals, especially the cattle, who mill around the area, making it dangerous to commuters. The irony now is that locals are beginning to stay away from the mandis, as they feel buying veggies from there might compromise their health. Says Colonel Nirmal Singh, a resident of Sector 71: "It's been more than 18 months since I last visited the mandi. Way too much dirty for me." Lt Col SS Sohi (retd), another resident of Sector 71, says he sent a petition to the commissioner and the MC on February 25 regarding this. But he received no response from them. He sent the petition again on June 10 and is now waiting for some concrete action by the MC. His petition, he says, does not just complain but also lists out actions that can be taken. He has even computed the cost of each solution that he has suggested. The million dollar question is: Will the MC take action before it is too late? BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Panchkula man\u2019s car, bike torched o.description: PANCHKULA: Unidentified miscreants set a two-wheeler and a car of a Panchkula’s Sector 20 resident on fire early on Thursday. Mahabir Singh, a resident of Ashiana Colony, said in his police complaint, “My neighbours raised the alarm on noticing my vehicles on fire around 2am. I along with them threw water on the vehicles to save them. While my two-wheeler (HR-03-Q-1906) was gutted, the car (HR-03-X-7005) was partially damaged.” Mahabir, a contractor, suspects a neighbour, with whom he had a scuffle some days ago, behind the vandalism. The police have registered a case under sections 427 (mischief causing damage to the amount of fifty rupees) and 435 (mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to cause damage to amount of one hundred or more) of the Indian Penal Code. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Panchkula: Participants get trained for.description: PANCHKULA: With International Yoga Day scheduled to be held on Friday, a pilot rehearsal of yoga was practised on Thursday in Parade Ground in Sector 5 by the Panchkula administration. Speaking at the event, the DC said that Yoga was not meant for a day or a week, it was supposed to be part of daily routine and meant for a healthy lifestyle. "The yoga balances your body and mind and one should do it on regular basis. Yoga is one of oldest form of art done by the ancestors to maintain their body and mind", said DC, Balkar Singh. Officials also said that yoga helps in curing many diseases and is working the same since a long time now. Over 200 countries has approved the Yoga and that is the reason June 21 is given the International Yoga Day. Singh appealed to the public at large to take part in the International Yoga Day to be celebrated by the administration in Parade Ground Sector-5. The DC informed that all the necessary arrangements including water, seating facility, toilets, electricity, had been finalized for the Yoga day and all preparations were complete to ensure that large numer of people are able to participate. The participants needed to enter the ground at 6.30 am. The yoga event will start at 7 am and will continue till 8 am. The chief guest at the event will be union Minister and Ambala member of parliament (MP) Rattan Lal Kataria. Meanwhile the experts from Patanjali Yog Samiti, Prem Ahuja and other assistants guided all the the participants on the pilot training day. During the pilot training, SDM Pankaj Setia, City Magistrate Gagandeep Singh, District Ayush Officer, Dalip Mishra, Tehsildar Virender Gill, Public Health Department, Education Department, Public works department, sport and youth affair department, among other officials were present. Punjab seeks review of infrastructure cr.description: CHANDIGARH: In view of more than 80% area of the state being under cultivation, the Punjab government has urged the Union government to review the criteria of minimum land requirement for developing industrial corridors under the Amritsar-Kolkata Industrial Corridor (AKIC) plan. Under the AKIC integrated manufacturing cluster scheme, states are required to develop industrial corridors on 10 sq.km. The state government’s contribution to this scheme is in the form of land and the Centre contributes an equivalent equity, which is the cost of land. Chief minister Amarinder Singh has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led central government to review the requirement of land under the scheme and exempt Punjab from this. At the same time, the chief minister has also urged the Centre to contribute “equivalent equity of land cost or 80% of development cost, whichever is higher”. The issue was raised by the state government by placing on record Amarinder’s speech during the June 15 meeting of the governing council of Niti Aayog. The state government has informed the Union government that the state with just 1.5% of country’s total land has more than 80% area under cultivation and allied agricultural activities. Therefore, accumulating contiguous land parcels of 10 sq.km is difficult. It has also urged the central government to consider raising the upper ceiling of its assistance for setting up of common facility centres for micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) from Rs 15 crore to Rs 25 crore. Punjab is implementing the MSMEs cluster development programme of the Union government to create common infrastructure for enhancing productivity and capacity building. The state government has identified 23 clusters which are at various stages of implementation. As six clusters have reached the stage of detailed project reports, the Centre has been requested to expedite these cluster proposals. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. Mohali: Three wounds on burnt body point.description: MOHALI: Almost a week after the charred body of a man was found in Sector 82 here, his autopsy report on Thursday points to three wound marks, probably inflicted by a sharp-edged weapon. The body of Ramesh Kumar, 45, was found on June 13 and his post-mortem was conducted by a panel of doctors at Rajindra Hospital in Patiala. A native of Raebareli who was residing in Sector 82, Ramesh was a soup vendor. His family identified him from his teeth, chin and a piece of cloth he always carried, said the police. His family — daughter Sarita, brothers Dinesh and Ramesh — had come from Raebareli to identify the body. Sohana station house officer inspector Manphul Singh said, “The autopsy found three injury marks, one behind the head, one in the chest and one in the abdomen. The wounds in chest and abdomen may be inflicted by a sharp-edged weapon, but behind the head he may have been hit by a stone. The autopsy also confirmed that he was killed five to six hours before his body was found.” Police said they have also come across some vital evidence as some people witnessed smoke emerging from the site near railway tracks around 3.30am to 4am. They thought it to be burning of dry leaves. “This proves that he must have been set afire around 4am,” said Singh. Panic had gripped the area when the 40% burnt body was spotted by a passerby around 8.30am. After the autopsy, the police have added Section 302 of the IPC to the FIR, said the SHO.
